metadata.Title: CVE-2020-7043 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in openfortivpn 1.11.0 when used with OpenSSLbefore 1.0.2. tunnel.c mishandles certificate validation because hostnamecomparisons do not consider '\0' characters, as demonstrated by agood.example.com\x00evil.example.com attack.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-7043` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

openfortivpn - 1.12.0-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: openfortivpn package in esm-apps/jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.12.0-1').
